bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition of serious li ji 痢疾 , ailment of free-flux illness, in children with lockjaw and an inability to consume food, closed eyes and abdominal pain and internal cramps with an unsuccessful urge to defecate. HYKY 11: 又有毒氣侵胃口亦不 飲食，或痢疾因食毒物，不見腸頭，鮮血頻滴，肛門寬大深黑可畏，腹 肚㽲痛，裏急後重，名曰刮腸 , “It may also be that poison qi enters the stomach and [the child can] not drink or eat. Or it suffers from the ailment of freeflux illness because it has eaten poisonous items. The tip of the intestine does not appear. Fresh blood repeatedly drops from the anus which is widened and so dark black that one may be frightened. The abdomen is in continuous pain. [Patients suffer from] internal cramps and a feeling of heavy pressure at their behind. This is called ‘brushed intestines ’”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry zhu 豕 writes: 小兒刮腸： 痢疾，禁口閉目至重者 , “ Brushed intestines of children : A very serious condition of free-flux illness with lockjaw and closed eyes”.
